src.optimization package¶

Submodules¶

src.optimization.energy_function module¶

src.optimization.energy_function.E(species)[source]¶

Energy function for a single species. That is the sum of all bounded domains attracting and unbounded domain repulsing each other

Parameters

species – Species object

Returns

src.optimization.energy_function.attract_bounded(domain1, domain2)[source]¶

Attraction term from the energy function

Parameters

  • domain1 – First bounded Domain object

  • domain2 – Second bounded Domain object

Returns

The euclidean distance between the second domain’s center and the where it should be in regards to the first domain

src.optimization.energy_function.repulse_unbounded(domain, other_domains)[source]¶

Repulsion term from the energy function

Parameters

  • domain – Domain object that repulses all other domains in the species, which are not bounded to this domain

  • other_domains – Other domains that are being repulsed

Returns

Sum of repulsions of other_domains by domain

src.optimization.optimization_worker module¶

class src.optimization.optimization_worker.OptimizationSignals[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

finished¶
rendered_species¶
update¶
class src.optimization.optimization_worker.OptimizationWorker(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QRunnable

Class extending QRunnable for running a single species rendering optimization in a separate thread of the main QThreadpool

optimize(species_instance, start_temp, end_temp, increment, cool, species_no)[source]¶

Performs the main loop of the simulated annealing

Parameters

  • species_instance – Species object to optimize

  • start_temp – Start temperature of the simulated annealing

  • end_temp – End temperature of the simulated annealing

  • increment – Upper bound on the movement of species’ hinges (in pixels)

  • cool – The temperature is decreased by multiplying the cool factor and the current temperature

  • species_no – Which species in the complex the species_instance is

Returns

Name of the species, optimized Species object

run()[source]¶

Main function of the OptimizationWorker that performs the optimization of the whole species complex

Returns

src.optimization.simulated_annealing module¶

src.optimization.simulated_annealing.decrease_temperature(T, cool)[source]¶

Cooling schedule of the optimization

Parameters

  • T – Current temperature

  • cool – Cooling factor

Returns

New temperature

src.optimization.simulated_annealing.move(initial_specie, increment)[source]¶

Performs the state change in the simulated annealing

Parameters

  • initial_specie – Species object to be changed

  • increment – Upper bound on the movement of species’ hinges (in pixels)

Returns

New Species object after the change

src.optimization.simulated_annealing.optimize_one_iteration(state, energy, increment, T, best_state, best_energy, iterations_number)[source]¶

Performs state change in the given temperature in simulated annealing

Parameters

  • state – Species object to be optimized

  • energy – Value of the initial state’s energy function E

  • increment – Upper bound on the movement of species’ hinges (in pixels)

  • T – Current temperature value

  • best_state – Reference value for the best state after the optimization (initially equal to state)

  • best_energy – Reference value for the energy of the best state after the optimization (initially equal to energy)

  • iterations_number – Number of state changes to perform (moves)

Returns
